text: Bottle at home late on Sunday upping the honjozo ticks. Handsome bottle. Pour is sight tinged water. Nose is light pear and some forest floor. Tastes of pear, pine nuts, pine needle, and alcohol. Watery palate but thats to style mostly. Some alcohol on finish. Pretty nice actually.

Bottle. Clear light yellow pour. floral, nuts, alcohol, rice and washi. very light and waterly throughout the mouth. Very simple and one dementional. slight bitter and acidic finish. Not bad but a typical honjozo, left best for use to cook food.
Bottle thanks to BMan1113VR. Clear with decent legs. Aroma is of booze, bread, and grapes. Taste is of booze, berries, grapes, light nut, and a little vanilla.
Bottle thanks to bman1113vr. Clear look, decent look, decent legs.  The smell is sweet, almond, licorice, nuts, and rice.  The taste is light, water chessnuts, and rice.
bottle thanks to bman1113vr.  looks like water with no head.  nose is wood and light fruits.  not what i was expecting at all.  rather thin on the palate with a flavor of chestnuts and light berries.
Bottle thanks to bman1113vr. Pours crystal clear. Aroma of faint melon and faint nuttiness. Flavor is very mellow, nutty. Mouth feel is very smooth, medium-heavy body. Overall, very smooth....

(bottle, courtesy of Bman1113vr)  Pours a transparent body with a slight yellowish hue and nice legs.  Aroma of almond and vanilla.  Flavor of almonds, vanilla, and water chestnuts with a bitter finish.
bottle, thanks to bman1113vr, light yellow greenish color, strong legs and good coconut, vanilla and water chestnuts aromas, flavor is a nutty, creaminess with alcohol present

Bottle. Pours with a clear water body and strong legs. Aroma of alcohol, strong koji, umami, and vanilla. Taste is umami, koji, cashew and a very light sweetness. Full mouthfeel and a balanced palate. Finishes dry.

Had on ice at dinner the other night. Clear pour with weak legs. Nose is boozey and rice like with hardly any other flavors. Mouth feel is dry and a bit grainy. I can tell that this is not a high quality sake but the taste is decent and gets the job done. Warming finish.

Glass at Tany 52 (NYC)...
Crystal clear, colorless beverage (much like water). The aroma is very vineous and alcoholic. Grainy flavor with a warm blast of alcohol (although the brew is served chilled). Balanced. Extra dry mouthfeel with no carbonation. I dont know if I will persue this sake rating thing. Sake is just so different that your average "beer".  Im having trouble seperating the apples from the oranges. Hmmm?

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2005 Bottle at Tatany 52 (NYC): Little detectable aroma with a slightly buttery taste (rich mouthfeel).  Evident dryness.  Very little alcohol burn.  Nice.  I really enjoyed this one!

Rerate: Had again at NYC restaurant called "Plate".  Decent.
